Billboard Sept 13-30 Schnitzler Play for Civic Rep. NEW YORK, Sept. 6.—The Civic Reper¬ tory Theater has chosen Arthur Schnitz¬ ler’s one-aet play, The-Green Cockatoo. as part of its program. The first perform¬ ance will be October 9, with Jacob Ben¬ Aml in the leading role, preceding a The Schnitzler play was first presented here in 1910 with Holbrook Blinn.

N T neview Cet 4-30 LIVIC REPERTORY OPENS MONDAY IN ROMEO AND JULIET“ Eva Le Gallienne and Don¬ ald Cameron Will Play Title Roles The Civie Repertorz Theatre vill open its fifth season on Monday eve¬ ning with “Romeo and Juliet.“ Eva Lo Gallelenne will be the Juliet; Donald Cameron, Romeo; Jacob Ben-Aml, Escalus, Prince of Verona; J. Edward Bromberg, Mercutlo, and Leona Rob¬ erts will agaln be seen as the Nurse. On Thursday evening, October 9, Jacob Ben-Aml will be seen for the first time as Henri in Arthur Schnitz¬ lers’ one-act play,“ The Green Cocka¬ too.“ This will precede The Lady Froz. Alfaqueque.“ The schedule for the reck will be as follows: Monday evening, October 6,Romeo and Juliet“ (opening). Tuesday evening, October 7, Cradle Song.“ Wednesday evening, October 8,Ro¬ meo and Julfet.“ Thursday matinee, October 9,"Cra¬ die Song.“ Thursday evening, October 9,"Green Cockatoo (opening) and Lady From Alfaqueque.“ Friday evening, October 10, Romeo and Juliet.“ Saturday matinee, October 11,Ro¬ meo and Juliet.“ Saturday evening, October 11.Green Cockatoo“ and Lady From Alfa¬ queque.“ Elght new productions will be made during the coming season. They are (The Green Cockatoo,“ by Schnitzler; (Siegfried,“ by Jean Giraudoux, open¬ Ing on October 20 with Jacob Ben-Amt in the title role; Allson’s House,“ by Susan Glaspell; The Nobel Prize,“ by H. Jalimar Bergman; Allee In Wonder¬ land“; Gruach,“ by Gordon Bottom¬ ley: Ardvorlich’s Wife,“ also by Bot¬ tomely, and Isben’s Rosmersholm.“ In addition to the new productions, the revivals of last year will be included.
